0.title: Deepika Padukone-backed startup FrontRow fires 30% staff over email
0.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup FrontRow has fired 145 employees, nearly 30% of its workforce, over an email citing a funding crunch. A report also said that another 150 employees resigned following the layoffs, bringing down the company’s total employee count to about 100. The startup counts Deepika Padukone's Family Office, Vishal Dadlani and Unacademy's Gaurav Munjal among its investors.

1.title: Sidhu Moosewala got threats from gangsters 4 years ago: Mika Singh
1.article_body: Singer Mika Singh has revealed in an interview that Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala used to talk about receiving threats from gangsters four years ago. He added, "Some gangsters might have tried to extort money from him this time." Mika further said that Sidhu told him he could roam freely in Mumbai without any security.

2.title: Moosewala's family being forced to get done last rites soon: Punjab Cong chief
2.article_body: The family of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead, is being forced to get the post-mortem and last rites done soon, Punjab Congress chief, Amarinder Singh Raja Warring, said. "Why was security withdrawn when there was a threat perception and it was made public?" Warring added. Moosewala's family earlier refused to allow post-mortem on his body, reports said.

3.title: Story of Raajneeti was incomplete; it will have a sequel: Prakash Jha
3.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha said that his film 'Raajneeti' will have a sequel. "Raajneeti is the only project where [the] story was incomplete so it will surely go into [a] sequel," he added. Jha further said that the sequel to Raajneeti is all set to be shot in Lucknow and they have already zeroed on the locations as well.

4.title: Consultation paper on crypto fairly ready: Economic Affairs Secy
4.article_body: Economic Affairs Secretary Ajay Seth on Monday said the consultation paper on cryptocurrencies is "fairly ready". "We've gone through deep dive, consulted not just domestic stakeholders but also organisations like the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank," Seth said. He added that the government is also beginning work on some sort of global regulations on cryptocurrencies.

5.title: T'gana minister attacked with chairs, stones by mob at public meeting
5.article_body: Telangana minister Chamakura Malla Reddy was allegedly attacked by an angry mob at a public meeting in Hyderabad on Sunday. Reddy was forced to leave the venue after the crowd allegedly started hurling chairs, water bottles and stones at him. The incident took place when Reddy praised the state government for various development and welfare programmes taken up in Telangana.

6.title: Russia suffered devastating losses among lower-ranked officers: UK
6.article_body: The UK on Monday said that Russia's military appears to have suffered devastating losses amongst mid- and junior-ranking officers in Ukraine. The loss of younger officers was likely to exacerbate Russia's problems in modernising its military command and control, it added. The ministry also claimed that there were multiple credible reports of localised mutinies amongst Russia's forces in Ukraine.

7.title: Match against Djokovic will be big challenge: Nadal on French Open QF match
7.article_body: Ahead of his French Open quarter-final match against Novak Djokovic on Tuesday, Rafael Nadal has said that it will be a "big challenge" for him. "I didn't play this kind of match for the last three months...Probably, he (Djokovic) will be confident. I know how my situation is, and I accept it well. I'm gonna fight for it," Nadal said.

8.title: Top 3 scorers of UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021 are women
8.article_body: The first three toppers of the UPSC Civil Services Examination, 2021, are women candidates. Of the 685 candidates who have qualified the exam, Shruti Sharma was declared the topper. Ankita Agarwal has ranked second, followed by Gamini Singla, who secured the third rank. Aishwarya Verma and Utkarsh Dwivedi were among the top five scorers.

9.title: Marcelo, who won record 25 trophies with Real Madrid, confirms leaving club
9.article_body: Brazilian defender Marcelo has announced that he'll be leaving Real Madrid, bringing an end to his 15-year-long stint with the Spanish club. Marcelo stated that he has played his last game for the club as he lifted his fifth and Madrid's 14th Champions League trophy on Saturday. The 34-year-old has won a record 25 trophies in total at the club.

10.title: 3 detained for throwing ink at farmer leader Rakesh Tikait in B'luru
10.article_body: Three people have been detained for throwing black ink at Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait at an event in Bengaluru on Monday, police said. The incident took place during a press conference. After the ink attack, Tikait said, "No security was provided by local police here. This has been done in collusion with the government."

11.title: Sensex jumps 1,041 points to end at 55,926, Nifty closes above 16,650
11.article_body: BSE Sensex jumped 1,041 points or 1.90% to close at 55,926 while NSE Nifty surged by 309 to settle at 16,661 on Monday. Titan, Infosys, Mahindra & Mahindra, Reliance Industries and TCS were among the lead gainers. Meanwhile, Ethos made its market debut today and ended at ₹802 per share, 8.6% down from its issue price of ₹878.

12.title: PM Modi congratulates students for clearing UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021
12.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated students who cleared the Civil Services (Main) Examination, 2021. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi wrote, "My best wishes to these youngsters who are embarking on their administrative careers at an important time of India's development journey, when we are marking Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav." JNU-alumna Shruti Sharma topped the examination.

13.title: They fired indiscriminately at my son from Corolla and Bolero: Moosewala's father
13.article_body: In his FIR, Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh said he saw a Corolla car with four occupants trailing his son's Thar and later a Bolero which was also carrying four youths stopped in front of his son's vehicle in Mansa. The occupants of the Corolla and Bolero started indiscriminate firing, Singh said. "Within minutes, the cars sped away," he added.

14.title: Still in shock, can't believe what has happened: Jasbir on Moosewala's death
14.article_body: Singer Jasbir Jassi, while condoling the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, said, "I'm still in shock and...can't believe...what has happened." "He was the only child and I cannot even begin to imagine what [his parents]...must be going through," he added. Jasbir further said Moosewala was extremely intelligent and had a "terrific knowledge about sound".

15.title: Will ask RR players to use this IPL final loss to achieve more: Buttler
15.article_body: After losing the IPL final on Sunday to Gujarat Titans, Rajasthan Royals batter Jos Buttler has said that he will ask his RR teammates to use "this hurt to achieve more in future". "I have lost plenty of finals in my career. It has been an absolute privilege to play in front of a big crowd (in Ahmedabad)," Buttler said.

16.title: Liverpool fans responsible for initial chaos at CL final: French Minister
16.article_body: France Sports Minister Amelie Oudea-Castera has held Liverpool fans without tickets responsible for the initial problems at the recent Champions League final. "(This) was a mass gathering of...(Liverpool) supporters without tickets," Amelie said. "When there are that many people by the entrance...there will be people trying to force their way in through the (stadium's) doors," she added.

17.title: Who is Shruti Sharma, JNU alumna who topped UPSC Civil Services 2021 exam?
17.article_body: Shruti Sharma from Uttar Pradesh's Bishnoi secured All India Rank 1 in the UPSC Civil Services 2021 exam. Sharma graduated from St Stephen's College of Delhi University and then got her postgraduate degree from Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) in Delhi. The history student prepared for UPSC at Jamia Millia Islamia Residential Coaching Academy.

18.title: Who were the highest run-scorers in IPL 2022?
18.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler top-scored in IPL 2022 with 863 runs in 17 innings. Buttler's tally of runs is the highest by an overseas player in an IPL season. LSG captain KL Rahul, who was the third-highest run-getter in IPL 2021, finished as the second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2022 with 616 runs. Rahul's teammate Quinton De Kock was the third-highest run-scorer.

19.title: Liberating Donetsk, Luhansk is Russia's unconditional priority: Lavrov
19.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Sunday said that the "liberation" of Donetsk and Luhansk regions in Ukraine's Donbas is an "unconditional priority" for Moscow. He added that the Russian Federation recognises the two regions as "independent states". Earlier, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba called Russia's offensive in Donbas "the largest one on European soil since World War II".

20.title: Punjab govt to set up judicial commission to probe Sidhu Moosewala’s killing
20.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has announced to set up judicial commission under the sitting judge of Punjab and Haryana High Court to investigate the killing of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. The singer's father had earlier written to CM Mann saying that his son left forever due to the government's failures.

21.title: Sidhu Moosewala's murder plot suspected to have links to Tihar Jail
21.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's murder plot is suspected to have links to Tihar Jail in Delhi, Hindustan Times reported while quoting a Delhi policeman. The officer said that a phone number has been traced to Tihar. He added that an arrested criminal named Mohammad Shahrukh was using a messaging app to communicate with gangster Goldy Brar, who claimed responsibility for the murder.

22.title: Fan compares Soni's 'Mandi' look to Alia's 'Gangubai...', she responds
22.article_body: Actress Soni Razdan has responded after a fan shared a clip of her from 1983 film 'Mandi' comparing her look as a sex worker to daughter Alia Bhatt's in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. The fan wrote, "Both have tremendous resemblance, both are best actresses. Soni then looks ditto Alia of now." Soni replied, "Oh gosh a blast from the past all right!"

23.title: UP bride refuses to marry groom after he fails to arrange photographer
23.article_body: A bride in Uttar Pradesh refused to marry after the groom forgot to bring along a photographer. She later went to her neighbour's house. "The man who didn't care about our marriage today, how is he going to take care of me in the future?" she said. Police claimed both parties returned the goods and cash given to each other.

24.title: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband arrested for drunk driving
24.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul Pelosi, was arrested for allegedly driving under the influence of alcohol in Napa County. He was booked on two counts - driving under the influence and driving with a blood alcohol content of 0.08% or higher. He was granted bail after paying $5,000, according to the public booking report.

25.title: My son Jehangir is a part of 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Kareena Kapoor
25.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan, taking to Instagram, shared the trailer of her film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Along with the trailer, she wrote, "One of my most special films...also because my Jeh (Jehangir) baba is very much a part of it (in my tummy)." She further thanked Aamir Khan and director Advait Chandan for having both, Jehangir and her, in the film.

26.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz enters maiden French Open quarters
26.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz reached his maiden French Open quarter-final after a 6-1, 6-4, 6-4 win against 21st seed Karen Khachanov on Sunday. Notably, the 19-year-old became the youngest male player in 29 years to reach two Grand Slam quarter-finals after also reaching the 2021 US Open last-eight. Sixth-seeded Alcaraz will next face third-seeded Alexander Zverev.

27.title: Fire at cargo complex in Mumbai airport; 3 fire trucks, 2 tankers sent
27.article_body: A tarpaulin shed at the cargo complex inside Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport caught fire on Monday. The fire brigade team reached the spot and was able to douse the fire. The Mumbai Fire Brigade reportedly sent three fire trucks and two jumbo tankers. Mumbai Fire Brigade chief officer said that a monsoon shed at the airport had caught fire.

28.title: I'm still in disbelief: Rahul Vaidya on Sidhu Moosewala's demise
28.article_body: Singer Rahul Vaidya mourned the demise of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. Speaking about it, Rahul said, "The news was so bad [that] I am still in disbelief. I've seen some pictures of his mother and I don't know what to say...It's high time such incidents should not happen in our country. Rest in peace, Sidhu Moosewala."

29.title: Johnny Depp joins Jeff Beck's concert for surprise performance in UK
29.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp joined Jeff Beck's concert in UK's Sheffield for a surprise performance on Sunday ahead of the verdict of his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Pictures and videos of his performance are going viral on social media. Depp sued Heard over her 2018 op-ed article in which she wrote she is a "public figure representing domestic abuse".

30.title: 'She said I was mistake?' Saif on Sharmila calling him spontaneous child
30.article_body: Reacting to his mother Sharmila Tagore calling him a spontaneous child, Saif Ali Khan jokingly said, "Does that mean...she had me spontaneously? It's like a borderline mistake. She said I was a mistake?" In a 2012 interview, Sharmila had said, "Saif was a...beautiful baby, he was a beautiful boy too...He was impulsive, spontaneous, and could grasp a situation at once."

31.title: Loan agent blackmails Hyd woman with morphed nude photos; arrested
31.article_body: A 23-year-old loan agent was arrested by Hyderabad Police for allegedly morphing photos of a woman and blackmailing her with them. The accused, Manish Kumar, allegedly sent morphed nude photos to victim after she failed to pay her EMIs for loan she had borrowed on an instant loan app. Kumar had also been sending abusive messages to victim, police said.

32.title: Metro rail work causes traffic jam at Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai
32.article_body: A traffic jam was witnessed on Monday morning at the Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai due to the ongoing metro rail work. "Huge traffic at eastern highway...5-6 km long jam from Mulund towards Kanjurmarg," a motorist tweeted. The dismantling of a crane at the site near JVLR junction in Vikhroli got delayed which led to the vehicular traffic, police said.

33.title: 20 mini-forests to be developed in densely-populated areas in Delhi
33.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is planning to develop at least 20 mini-forests in densely populated areas in the city. As per data released by the corporation, the horticulture wing of the civic body will plant saplings of 85,000 trees and 5,20,000 shrubs this year. As many as 17 mini-forests were developed in the city last year.

34.title: Someone said our team wasn't good after mega auction: GT's Saha after winning IPL 2022
34.article_body: After winning IPL 2022 by defeating Rajasthan Royals (RR), Gujarat Titans (GT) wicketkeeper-opener Wriddhiman Saha said, "Someone said our team was not good after the auctions, but we proved them wrong." He added that it was his fifth final and the second final which he won. GT defeated RR by 7 wickets in the final.

35.title: Hyd Archbishop Anthony Poola to be 1st Telugu & Dalit Cardinal
35.article_body: Archbishop of Hyderabad, Anthony Poola, is the first Telugu and Dalit man who will be elevated to the rank of Cardinal of the Catholic Church by Pope Francis. Poola, a native of Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool district, is among 21 other churchmen who will be ordained as Cardinals by Pope. The ceremony will be held on August 27 in Vatican City.

36.title: People will never know what Punjabi artists deal with daily: AP on Moosewala's death
36.article_body: Singer AP Dhillon took to Instagram to react to Sidhu Moosewala's death, saying he was "praying for his family". Dhillon said, "Most people will never know...what you've to deal with as a Punjabi artist...on a daily basis, with constant judgement, hate-filled comments, threats...directed toward people like us." He added, "I...admired how Sidhu was able to rise above it all."

37.title: 18-year-old model found dead in Kolkata, 3rd such incident in a week
37.article_body: An 18-year-old model and make-up artist, Saraswati Das, has been found dead at her residence in Kolkata. "It seems that it's a case of suicide, but we need to look into other angles too," police said. This is the third such incident within a week after the death of models Manjusha Neogi and Bidisha De Majumdar.

38.title: Winning IPL is the biggest achievement of my career: GT's Rashid Khan
38.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan said winning the IPL 2022 is the biggest achievement of his career. "You always want to do well in big competitions like this," he added. "Winning tournaments like this, you'll need to put in...hard work and this is certainly a high point of my career," he stated. GT defeated RR by 7 wickets in the final.

39.title: Rakesh Tikait attacked with ink, people throw chairs at one another at B'luru event
39.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait was attacked with black ink during a press conference in Bengaluru. "No security has been provided by the local police here. This has been done in collusion with the government," the farmer leader alleged. Following the incident, people were purportedly seen throwing chairs at one another in a video that has surfaced online.

40.title: Muslims won't accept interference in Islamic laws: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind on UCC
40.article_body: The Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind (JUH) passed a resolution against Uniform Civil Code (UCC), saying that Muslims will not accept any kind of interference in Islamic laws. "The government in power is determined to implement the UCC…and is trying to neglect the real spirit of the Constitution," the resolution said. Issues like marriage, divorce and inheritance are guided by religion, it said.

41.title: Portion of ceiling collapses at Pune Fire Brigade's central station
41.article_body: A part of the ceiling of the main building of the Central Fire Station in Pune collapsed on Monday. As per reports, nobody was at the spot when the incident took place, but two firemen were standing nearby. This comes days after a portion of the ceiling of the control room of Pune Fire Brigade had collapsed.

42.title: Oil price crosses $120 mark ahead of EU meeting on Russia sanctions
42.article_body: Oil price crossed the $120 mark on Monday, climbing to its highest in over two months, ahead of European Union's meeting which could lead to a ban on Russian oil imports. Brent crude futures was up 47 cents to $119.90/barrel after rising to $120.50/barrel earlier in the session. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures jumped 72 cents to $115.79/barrel.

43.title: Shubman Gill's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting IPL 2022-winning six goes viral
43.article_body: A video of GT opener Shubman Gill's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting a six to win IPL 2022 final for his team against RR has gone viral. Gill took off his helmet and let out a roar after slamming the match-winning six. Gill finished the match unbeaten on 45 off 43 balls.

44.title: Up to ₹13 cr briefly credited in 100 HDFC accounts in Chennai due to technical error
44.article_body: HDFC Bank froze around 100 accounts in Chennai after these accounts were credited with a few thousand rupees to ₹13 crore. The bank attributed this to a technical error which was noticed in a few customer accounts after a routine upgrade on Saturday. While the hold was released a few hours later, several users took to Twitter about the same.

45.title: Trapped in scams before 2014, India now achieving new heights: PM
45.article_body: India was trapped in scams and nepotism before 2014 but it is achieving new heights now, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. "Corruption, scams...nepotism…the country is getting out of the vicious cycle in which it was trapped before 2014," PM added. "The heights that India has achieved in the last eight years, no one could have imagined earlier," he stated.

46.title: 1 killed, 5 injured in IED blast in community hall in Manipur
46.article_body: One person died in an IED blast that took place in a community hall in Manipur on Monday. The blast took place at Sapam Mayai Leikai in Khongjom. Five people were injured in the incident. Police said that the area has been cordoned for forensic inspection. The injured were taken to Thoubal Hospital.

47.title: Bengaluru reports over 200 new COVID-19 cases after nearly 3 months
47.article_body: Bengaluru reported over 200 new COVID-19 cases after nearly three months with 232 cases, according to BBMP data published on Sunday. The data showed that the city reported no new deaths due to the virus and that the positivity rate is at 1.2%. The number of active COVID-19 clusters in the city is five, the data also showed.

48.title: Had GT lost another wicket in first 8-9 overs, they would've been in trouble: Sehwag
48.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said that GT didn't score much in the first eight-nine overs while chasing RR's 130-run total in IPL 2022 final and had they lost another wicket at that time, they would've been in trouble. "But Hardik Pandya's innings was crucial, may seem small on paper, but those 34 runs were very important," Sehwag added.

49.title: Vodafone Idea shares jump on report that Amazon may invest ₹20,000 crore
49.article_body: Shares of Vodafone Idea rose sharply on Monday after The Ken reported that American e-commerce giant Amazon may invest up to ₹20,000 crore in the telecom service provider. The company's shares jumped to an intraday high of ₹9.45 on the NSE. As per The Ken, Amazon had carried out due diligence on Vodafone Idea in the first quarter of 2021.

50.title: I never called Moosewala gangster, says Punjab DGP after singer's father demands apology
50.article_body: Punjab DGP VK Bhawra on Monday said that he condemned in the "strongest terms" the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, adding that he never called him a gangster. This comes after Moosewala's father wrote a letter to Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann, seeking an apology from the Punjab DGP for relating his son's murder to gang war.

51.title: Hardik is humble, was eager to learn as captain: Gary Kirsten
51.article_body: After winning the IPL 2022, Gujarat Titans coach Gary Kirsten has said that captain Hardik Pandya showed eagerness to learn in his first IPL season as a captain. "He's (Pandya) a high-profile player in India but he's incredibly humble, wanting to learn as a leader and engage with his players which I think is really, really important," Kirsten said.

52.title: Rajya Sabha has become a parking lot: Congress' Manish Tewari
52.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Monday said that the Rajya Sabha has now become a "parking lot". "In my personal opinion, Rajya Sabha has stopped carrying out the functions for which it was constituted," Tewari added. It needs to be examined whether or not the country needs the Rajya Sabha now, the Congress leader stated.

53.title: 30 traffic signals at busy Pune junctions dysfunctional for over 20 days
53.article_body: Thirty traffic signals have not been functioning for over 20-25 days at the busiest junctions in Pune, leading to traffic congestion. "Some signals are not working due to the ongoing metro and drainage pipeline work, while others have technical faults," DCP (Traffic) said. "The repair work of signals is underway and work will be completed soon," a civic official said.

54.title: Batting at no. 4 is perfect position for Hardik in T20Is: Vettori
54.article_body: Ex-New Zealand skipper Daniel Vettori said Hardik Pandya batting at number four for Team India in T20Is is a "perfect position" for him. "You don't want to take anything away from...Suryakumar Yadav. But, if this option's there, it'll be great," he stated. He added Hardik might play at number five "as of now" with Rishabh Pant dropping to number six.

55.title: They could've done a lot of things differently: Harbhajan on RR's defeat
55.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has said RR could have done a lot of things differently in the IPL 2022 final against GT, which they lost by seven wickets. "Firstly, I felt they should have chased...They should have strung partnerships; 160 runs are enough in a final. They did not bat well...GT was the better team," stated Harbhajan.

56.title: Forever 21 owner Authentic Brands Group in talks to acquire Ted Baker: Report
56.article_body: US-based Authentic Brands Group, owner of brands like Forever 21 and Reebok is reportedly in talks to acquire Ted Baker. Shares of Ted Baker rose 3.1% on Monday following this report. It added that the two companies could agree on a £300 million deal for the same. British fashion retailer Ted Baker had put itself up for sale in April.

57.title: Nitesh Tiwari, Ashwiny announce new project 'Bas Karo Aunty!'
57.article_body: Filmmaker couple Nitesh Tiwari and Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari have teamed up with Star Studios, Ronnie Screwvala and Siddharth Roy Kapur to produce film 'Bas Karo Aunty!'. Based on Varun Agarwal's book 'How I Braved Anu Aunty and Co-Founded a Million Dollar Company', the young-adult comedy-drama will be directed by Abhishek Sinha and it'll feature Ishwak Singh and Mahima Makwana.

58.title: Dad bought 'Zanjeer' script from Dharmendra for ₹3,500: Prakash Mehra's son
58.article_body: Late filmmaker Prakash Mehra's son Puneet Mehra said that his father had bought the script of 'Zanjeer' from actor Dharmendra for ₹3,500. Puneet said his father loved the script and Dharmendra was to play lead role in the movie. However, the actor was busy for a year. Prakash did not want to wait since he thought people would forget him.

59.title: Nottingham Forest get promoted to the Premier League after 23 years
59.article_body: Nottingham Forest will be returning to the Premier League after 23 years after the football club defeated Huddersfield Town 1-0 in the Championship playoff final. The match took place at Wembley on Sunday. Huddersfield defender Levi Colwill scored an own goal in the match. Along with Nottingham, Fulham and AFC Bournemouth have been promoted to the Premier League.

60.title: 10 lakh smart meters to come up to beat electricity reading errors in Mumbai
60.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport, which also provides electricity connection along with the bus transportation service in Mumbai, has decided to install 10 lakh smart meters to tackle electricity reading errors. The smart meters will be enabled with 4G and 5G SIM cards. Consumers can track their usage and recharge them similar to that of mobile phones, officials said.

61.title: 'Godman' allegedly rapes woman on pretext of curing her son in Pune
61.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 60-year-old self-proclaimed godman for allegedly raping a 36-year-old woman. The accused had done so under the pretext of performing rituals to cure her son's physical disability and improve the family's financial condition. The incident occurred when the accused went to the woman's house and reportedly forced her to disrobe under the guise of "a spell".

62.title: UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021 final results declared, Shruti Sharma tops exam
62.article_body: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the final results of Civil Services Examination, 2021. Shruti Sharma has topped the examination, while Ankita Agarwal and Gamini Singla secured the second and the third rank, respectively. A total number of 685 candidates have been recommended for appointment, according to an official press release.

63.title: My son left forever due to govt's failure, his mother asks when he'll return: Sidhu's father
63.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has written a letter to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann after his son's murder. He wrote, "Due to failures of your government, my son left us forever." He added, "Shubhdeep's mother asks me where is her son and when will he return home. What answer should I give her? I hope I will get justice."

64.title: Key accused in Assam police station fire 'accidentally' run over by escort vehicle, dies
64.article_body: The man, Ashikul Islam, who was accused of inciting a mob to set the police station in Assam's Nagaon on fire was killed as an escort vehicle "accidentally" ran over him on Monday, police said. Reports said he was trying to run away from police custody. Three police personnel were also injured in the incident.

65.title: Absolutely devastating: Lilly Singh mourns Sidhu Moosewala's demise
65.article_body: YouTuber-comedian Lilly Singh took to Instagram to mourn the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Absolutely devastating and upsetting news," Lilly wrote while adding, "Through his revolutionary music, he'll live on. Beyond the care he had for his community, he created the soundtrack that made many of us feel seen, a perfect blend of hip hop, rap and folk music."

66.title: Peru to open criminal investigation into President Pedro Castillo
66.article_body: Peru's Public Ministry announced on Sunday that National Prosecutor Pablo Sanchez will open a preliminary investigation into President Pedro Castillo over alleged crimes like peddling, collusion and criminal organisation. The investigation, which was initially opened against a former minister and six congressmen, will now include Castillo due to the "seriousness" of the accusations, it said.

67.title: Cong will go with collective leadership in Gujarat polls: Mevani
67.article_body: Congress backed independent MLA Jignesh Mevani has said that the party will go with a "collective leadership" in this year's Gujarat Assembly polls. However, Mevani cleared that he is not among the contenders to become CM if Congress wins the polls. "Gujarat's people are aware of the situation...during the COVID-19, the performance of the Gujarat government was pathetic," Mevani said.

68.title: Hardik cleaned up RR's heart, heartbeat, kidney in the final: Aakash
68.article_body: Ex-India batter Aakash Chopra, speaking about GT skipper Hardik Pandya's three-wicket haul versus RR in IPL 2022 final, said, "Hardik cleaned up the heart, heartbeat and kidney." Aakash added, "The captain came to the forefront in the grand finale, when do you get to see that many times?" Hardik dismissed Sanju Samson, Jos Buttler and Shimron Hetmyer in the match.

69.title: Man accused of raping stepdaughter dies in police custody in Delhi
69.article_body: A 40-year-old man, accused of raping his stepdaughter, died in police custody in Delhi. Denying allegations of custodial assault, the police said that the man was beaten up by the locals before he was arrested and that might have caused his death. The police said they took the man to the lock-up only after the doctors had discharged him.

70.title: Punjab CM orders inquiry into Moosewala's security cut, agrees to judicial probe
70.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday ordered an inquiry into the decision to reduce security of singer Sidhu Moosewala. Further, Punjab government will request Chief Justice of Punjab and Haryana High Court to get the murder case inquired into by the sitting judge of the High Court, Chief Minister's Office said. This comes after Moosewala's father wrote to CM Mann.

71.title: Will sell my clothes to provide cheapest wheat flour to people: Pak PM
71.article_body: Amid a wheat shortage, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif gave an ultimatum to the CM of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province asking him to reduce the price of a 10 kg wheat flour bag to ₹400 within the next 24 hours. Sharif said if the CM failed to do so, "I would sell my outfits and provide the cheapest wheat flour to people."

72.title: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Pulwama
72.article_body: Two local terrorists were killed in an encounter by the security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Monday, said police. The encounter started in the Gundipora area on Sunday based on the inputs received from Kulgam Police. According to Kashmir Zone Police, two terrorists belonging to JeM, including the killer of Constable Reyaz Ahmad, were trapped.

73.title: It defines the law & order situation in Punjab: Kangana on Moosewala's killing
73.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Monday to express grief over the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. "This is a sad incident," she wrote, adding, "This incident defines the law and order situation in Punjab." Moosewala was shot dead by unidentified assailants in a village in Mansa.

74.title: Moosewala's mother criticises Punjab CM outside hospital after son's murder
74.article_body: A video of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's mother Charan Kaur criticising Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann outside the civil hospital in Mansa, where her son was declared dead, is being widely circulated on social media. Reports said that Moosewala's mother blamed Punjab government and demanded justice. Notably, Moosewala's security was reduced a day before he was shot dead.

75.title: It stared, we had nowhere to hide: Guj farmer on finding lion on house roof
75.article_body: A farmer, who found a lion on the roof of his house in Gujarat while he and his family were sleeping, said that the lion stared at his family and his cattle and that they had nowhere to hide. "We kept flashing torches at the lion but it refused to climb down the roof," the farmer added.

76.title: Drake shares pic of Sidhu Moosewala with his mother, writes 'RIP Moose'
76.article_body: Canadian rapper Drake took to his Instagram Stories to mourn the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district on Sunday. Sharing a picture of Moosewala with his mother, Drake wrote, "RIP Moose." As per police, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang has claimed responsibility for Moosewala's murder.

77.title: He was getting extortion & threat calls from Lawrence Bishnoi gang: Moosewala's father
77.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, was "getting extortion and threat to life calls from Lawrence Bishnoi gang and others", according to an FIR filed by his father Balkaur Singh. Moosewala had bought a bulletproof Toyota Fortuner in the wake of these threats but left home without his SUV and gunmen on Sunday, the FIR added.

78.title: Somebody trying to test new govt's red lines: Manish Tewari on Moosewala's killing
78.article_body: Following Punjabi Singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, Congress leader Manish Tewari said it's obvious that somebody is trying to test the red lines of the new government. "Since the new government was formed in Punjab, there have been a series of unfortunate incidents...If peace of a border state gets disturbed then it can have various implications," Tewari added.

79.title: We'll meet Shah if we don't get justice: Punjab Cong chief on Moosewala's killing
79.article_body: After Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa, state Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said the party will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah if they don't get justice. "We will go to high court and will meet the Governor," Warring added. "It needs to be investigated under a sitting judge and the NIA," he stated.

80.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family seeks CBI and NIA probe into his murder
80.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's family has sought a CBI and NIA probe into his murder. His father wrote to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, saying that a CBI and NIA probe is must. The family has also sought action against officials who leaked the list of individuals who were stripped of security cover. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

81.title: Parking rates reduced at Noida's Sector 18 market, starts from ₹10
81.article_body: After constant demands from traders and customers, the Noida Authority has reduced the parking rates in Noida's Sector 18 market. The reduced rates will be implemented on both, surface and multi-level parking lots. Four-wheelers and two-wheelers will now be charged ₹20 and ₹10 respectively for 30 minutes while for up to four hours, it will be ₹50 and ₹25 respectively.

82.title: Bad day for music industry: Diljit Dosanjh on Sidhu Moosewala's death
82.article_body: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh reacted to singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's demise. Taking to Twitter, Diljit wrote, "The boy had a lot of talent. I never met him but his hard work spoke for him. This is hard for the parents." "It's a very bad day for the music industry," he added. Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

83.title: Daughter refuses to believe I voiced Maui, says 'you're The Rock': Dwayne
83.article_body: Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson has shared that his four-year-old daughter Tiana "refuses to believe" that he had voiced a character from one of her favourite Disney films. "She still refuses to believe her daddy is...MAUI from one of her favourites, MOANA! She always says, 'Daddy, you're not Maui, you're The Rock'," he added. The animated movie was released in 2016.

84.title: RR need a batter who's a little more consistent than Riyan: Manjrekar
84.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said RR, who lost IPL 2022 final to GT, currently have 80-90 per cent of the "right team" for the next IPL season. Manjrekar added, "They need a batter who's a little more consistent than...maybe Riyan Parag and can also bowl two-three overs." Riyan scored 183 runs in 14 innings in IPL 2022.

85.title: Tata Motors signs MoU with Gujarat govt for acquisition of Ford's Sanand plant
85.article_body: Tata Motors has signed an MoU with the Gujarat government for the potential acquisition of Ford India's Sanand plant, it said in a regulatory filing. The agreement includes a transfer of Ford India's land, buildings, vehicle manufacturing plant, machinery and transfer of all eligible employees. As per a report, Tata Motors would pay $100-150 million for the plant.

86.title: 1 killed, 7 wounded in shooting at Oklahoma festival in US
86.article_body: A 39-year-old woman was killed and seven other people were wounded in a shooting that took place at an outdoor festival in US' Oklahoma. "Bullets were literally flying everywhere," said an eyewitness. According to the witnesses, the shooting was preceded by an argument. A 26-year-old man has been taken into custody, said the authorities.

87.title: Kamal meets Rajinikanth ahead of Vikram's release, director shares pics
87.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan met actor Rajinikanth ahead of the release of his film 'Vikram'. The film's director Lokesh Kanagaraj and producer R Mahendran also met Rajinikanth. Lokesh, taking to Twitter, shared pictures of the meeting and wrote, "Thank you Kamal sir! Rajinikanth sir! What a friendship! Inspiring." Actors Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil also feature in the film.

88.title: Zelenskyy fires Kharkiv security chief for 'not working to defend city
88.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that he dismissed the head of Security Service in Kharkiv for "not working to defend the city from...first days of a full-scale war, but thinking only of himself". However, he praised the army, police, city's Mayor and regional state administration for "working very effectively". Zelenskyy had visited the city on the same day.

89.title: 14 bodies found at Nepal plane crash site, official says 'Suspect all 22 died'
89.article_body: Fourteen bodies have been recovered so far in Mustang, Nepal where Tara Air plane carrying 22 people including four Indians crashed on Sunday. "We suspected all the passengers on board the aircraft have lost their lives. Our preliminary assessment shows no one could have survived the plane crash, but official statement is due," said a spokesperson in Nepal's Home Ministry.

90.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father followed him with 2 policemen in another car, saw his killing
90.article_body: Punjab Police have registered an FIR in connection with Sidhu Moosewala's killing at Sadar police station in Mansa on the statement of his father Balkaur Singh. Singh said he was witness to the fatal attack on his son. Singh "took both police security personnel in his car after he learnt that Moosewala had left home without guards", the FIR said.

91.title: Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims: Uttar Pradesh minister
91.article_body: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims and no one's constitutional rights are being violated. "We've to listen to the voice of common Muslims," Ansari added. "Today, they want to progress that was not done by previous governments, like, SP, BSP and Congress. They only used Muslims as a vote bank," he stated.

92.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family refuses to allow post-mortem on his body: Reports
92.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's family has refused to allow post-mortem on his body, reports said. This comes after senior police officials held discussion with the late singer's family. The family members have sought NIA probe into the murder and action against officials who leaked the list of individuals who were stripped of security cover

93.title: Prices of tomatoes may soon cross ₹100 per kg in Pune: Traders
93.article_body: As tomato prices have crossed the ₹80 per kg mark in several areas of Pune, traders reportedly said that the price would soon cross ₹100 per kg. Reports said that lower than expected plantation is the main reason for price rise. For the last three years, farmers have reportedly blamed the tomato mosaic virus for loss of produce.

94.title: Children who lost parents to COVID-19 to get ₹4,000 per month: PM Modi
94.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday announced that children who lost their parents to COVID-19 will be provided ₹4,000 monthly through various schemes to meet their daily requirements. Releasing the benefits under the PM CARES for Children scheme, he added, "If someone needs an education loan for professional courses, for higher education, then PM CARES will help in that too."

95.title: People love Hardik because of things he does on field, not off the field: Sehwag
95.article_body: Questioning GT captain Hardik Pandya's critics, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said the all-rounder "stood apart across all three departments" in IPL 2022 and people love him "because of the things he does on the field, not off the field". Sehwag added, "The personality off the field does not matter, it is absolutely irrelevant...it makes no impact on the field."

96.title: France to euthanise killer whale suffering from black fungus
96.article_body: The French authorities have decided to euthanise an orca, also known as killer whale, stranded in the Seine river, after efforts to save it failed. The officials believe that the animal is suffering from mucormycosis or black fungus and is critically ill. A group of experts concluded that it was best to put the animal out of its misery.

97.title: US Prez, First Lady visit site where 21 were killed in shooting
97.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden visited the school in Texas where 21 people, including 19 children, were killed in a shooting. The Bidens paid respects to the deceased at the memorial site at Robb Elementary School and attended a church mass. People outside the church urged Biden to "do something". "We will," replied President Biden.

98.title: Another Tara Air plane crashed on same Nepal route in 2016 killing 23 passengers
98.article_body: In 2016, a Tara Air plane carrying 23 passengers from Pokhara to Jomsom in Nepal lost contact and was later found crashed, killing all passengers on board. While the total time of the flight was 19 minutes, it lost contact eight minutes after taking off. The wreckage of the Tara Air flight with 22 passengers was found on Monday.

99.title: PM gives guidance to world but is silent on violence in Andhra: Raut
99.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi gives guidance to the world but is silent on occasions like violence in Andhra Pradesh over renaming of Konaseema district after Dr Ambedkar. "Modi is leading the nation with the maximum number of unemployed people and...he attends events on world stage," he added.

100.title: Ranveer Singh, Varun Dhawan condole Sidhu Moosewala's demise
100.article_body: Ranveer Singh and Varun Dhawan took to their respective social media handles to express condolences on the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "RIP. Your words and music will live on. Can't believe this," Varun wrote. Meanwhile, Ranveer shared a picture of Moosewala with a caption that read, "Immortal." Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

101.title: I am Hindu but not fool, we don't make religion an event: Kamal Nath
101.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Kamal Nath said religion is not the basis of politics. "We don't consider religion as the basis of our politics. We don't make religion an event," Nath added. "I proudly say that I am Hindu but I am not a fool…Our religion is an event of our family, it's not an event of politics," Nath stated.

102.title: He can influence people without even trying: Naga on 'Laal...' co-star Aamir
102.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who'll be making his Bollywood debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha', opened up about his experience while working with Aamir Khan. "One thing is for sure that, what I've learnt in last 12 years, I learnt from him in 45 days," he said. "He's got this amazing magic that he can influence people without even trying," Naga added.

103.title: 3 killed, 9 injured after lightning strikes eatery in Chhattisgarh
103.article_body: Three people, including a 12-year-old girl, were killed and nine others were injured in a lightning strike in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur on Sunday, police said. According to preliminary information, lightning had struck an eatery at a weekly market, the district Additional SP Pratibha Pandey said. Meanwhile, state CM Bhupesh Baghel announced ₹4 lakh each as compensation to the deceased's families.

104.title: Civic body to remove illegal gates of housing societies in Ghaziabad
104.article_body: In a move to free public roads, the Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has decided to remove illegal gates of non-gated housing societies. "The corporation has not given any permission...and...movement of public cannot be restricted," an official said. "There are many societies in Shalimar Garden, Rajendra Nagar...who do not allow gates to be opened up for the public," a resident said.

105.title: Gleam on the face of this man tells he will die young: Moosewala sang in 'The Last Ride'
105.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala in one of his last songs 'The Last Ride' sang, "Moosewala has become immortal in his life, but the gleam on the face of this man tells that he will die young." Moosewala said in interviews that his inspiration was Tupac Shakur (known as 2Pac), the American rapper who too was shot dead in his car in 1996.

106.title: The fire could be heard in the village for a few minutes: Moosewala murder witness
106.article_body: An eyewitness at Jawahar Ke village where Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead has said, "The fire could be heard in the village for a few minutes." He added, "A white car came from behind and then drove parallel to Moosewala's car before opening fire...Then the white car drove up ahead and opened fire from the front."

107.title: 'I will live here and I will die here', Moosewala told voters at his village during polls
107.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala promised voters while campaigning during Punjab polls that he will always be there in his ancestral village. "I am not going anywhere. I will live here and I will die here," he would tell voters during the campaign in February. Moosewala, who was shot dead on Sunday, had fought Punjab elections for Congress from Mansa seat.

108.title: He'll have to think about bowling more off spin: Sangakkara on Ashwin
108.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said Ravichandran Ashwin needs to think about bowling more off-spin deliveries. "Even for Ashwin, being a legend in terms of what he has achieved...there will be a lot of thinking and improvements to do," stated Sangakkara after their seven-wicket defeat against GT in IPL 2022 final. Ashwin registered figures of 3-0-32-0 against GT.

109.title: Sensex jumps over 900 points to 55,792, Nifty above 16,500
109.article_body: BSE Sensex rallied over 900 points to trade at 55,792 while the Nifty50 advanced 258 points to 16,611 during Monday's early trade. While Infosys, Mahindra & Mahindra, Wipro and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) were among the top Sensex gainers, shares of IRCTC rose nearly 5% in early trade ahead of its earnings to be announced today.

110.title: India may face power crisis in July-Aug amid coal shortage: Report
110.article_body: A report by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA), an independent research organisation, has suggested India may face a power crisis in July-August amid a coal shortage. As per CREA, the coal power plants cannot "address even a minor spike in the power demand" while it predicted a peak power demand of 214 GW in August.

111.title: After Ram Temple in Ayodhya, looks like Kashi & Mathura waking up too: UP CM
111.article_body: The temple town of Kashi appears to be waking up, as are Mathura, Vrindavan, Vindhyavasini Dham and Naimish Dham, after the construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "In this situation, we all have to move forward once again," CM Yogi added. His remarks came amid legal proceedings over the temple-mosque issues in Varanasi and Mathura.

112.title: JD(S) workers, farmer leader Kodihalli's supporters clash in B'luru
112.article_body: JD(S) workers and supporters of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha leader Kodihalli Chandrashekar clashed in Bengaluru as the farmer leader arrived at the Press Club to address corruption charges raised against him over KSRTC workers' protests. The JD(S) workers had raised slogans and reportedly tried to stop Chandrashekar from entering the Press Club. Chandrashekar had joined AAP recently.

113.title: India reports 2,706 new COVID-19 cases, 25 deaths in last 24 hours
113.article_body: India has reported 2,706 COVID-19 cases, 2,070 recoveries and 25 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,828 COVID-19 cases and 14 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,698, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,611.

114.title: Take action against these criminals: Mika on Sidhu Moosewala's death
114.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, taking to Twitter, mourned the demise of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. "My prayers are with his family. Request to Punjab government, please take strong action against these criminals," Mika tweeted. "People will always remember your name...the respect you earned and all your hit records," he added. Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

115.title: I still get anxious thinking about hurtling down Indian roads: Actor Sam Neill
115.article_body: Hollywood actor Sam Neill, sharing his experience of working in India, said, "It was...amazing." "I still get anxious when I think of hurtling down Indian roads in one of those sort of 50s Morris taxis, dodging people...I'd have to close my eyes...because every minute we seem to be close to death," he added. Sam came to India in the 90s.

116.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Dwarka building, 52 people evacuated; 10 vehicles gutted
116.article_body: Ten vehicles were burnt after a fire broke out in the parking of a building in Delhi. The incident took place in Dwarka on Sunday night. After the fire broke out in the building, 52 people were evacuated. Among the evacuated were five people who sustained minor injuries during the incident.

117.title: Some of the bodies of the passengers are beyond recognition: Official on Nepal plane crash
117.article_body: The wreckage of Nepal's Tara Air aircraft which went missing with 22 people on board on Sunday was physically located in Mustang district on Monday. Chief District Officer of Mustang, Netra Prasad Sharma said, "Some of the bodies of the passengers are beyond recognition. Police are gathering the remain." Notably, A family of four Indians was also aboard the plane.

118.title: Full list of IPL 2022 award winners with cash prize released
118.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler won 'Orange Cap' for scoring the most runs (863), while RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal won 'Purple Cap' for taking the most wickets (27) in IPL 2022. Umran Malik won the 'Emerging Player' award, while Jos Buttler won the award for most sixes (45). RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik was named 'Super Striker' of the season.

119.title: India Post delivers mail using drone for 1st time under pilot project in Guj
119.article_body: In a first, the Department of Posts delivered mail using a drone under a pilot project in Gujarat. The drone covered a distance of 46 km in 25 minutes, said an official. The pilot project studied the cost of drone deliveries and roadblocks in the process. "If the experiment is commercially successful...postal parcel delivery services will be faster," PIB stated.

120.title: Protest held at Greater Noida society after 2 kids fell from 9th floor
120.article_body: Days after two kids fell from the shaft of the ninth floor of Supertech Ecovillage-2 society in Greater Noida West, the residents held a protest against the builder over safety lapses. The new towers, where possession has been recently given, don't have quality work, complained a resident. The Greater Noida Authority has served a notice to Supertech over compliance.

121.title: This season was really special, really proud of my team: Samson
121.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said it was "one off day" for them as they lost the IPL 2022 final to GT but he's "really proud" of his team. "Last two-three seasons...everyone was having a really hard time. Good to give them some happy moments," he added. RR had finished among the bottom two teams in the last three seasons.

122.title: BJP needs no certificate from Majlis: G Kishan Reddy on Owaisi's remarks
122.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy has responded to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's recent statements that the BJP and RSS are "only after Mughals". "Numerous Hindus had to leave their residence under Owaisi's leadership...We don't want the certificate of Majlis party given to us nor to our government," Reddy said. He added that Owaisi is selling and telling stories.

123.title: Family asked me to think twice: Archana on marrying 7 years younger Parmeet
123.article_body: Actress Archana Puran Singh said her family had asked her to "think twice" before she married actor Parmeet Sethi since he is seven years younger than her. "I never had any doubt in my mind...after 30 years and two sons...we are still a couple who...has faced ups and downs of life together without...age factor ever coming in focus," she added.

124.title: Indian family on board Nepal flight were on a trip due to a divorce order
124.article_body: A divorced couple and their two children, who were among the 22 people on board the plane that crashed in Nepal, were on a family holiday ordered by a court after their divorce. As per a police official, the family got together for 10 days every year after the couple's divorce. On Monday, the wreckage of the plane was found.

125.title: Pune man seeks ₹9 cr as extortion from real estate developer; held
125.article_body: Pune's Wakad police have arrested a man for allegedly demanding about ₹9 crore as extortion from a real estate developer. The accused had filed a case with NGT claiming that there were irregularities in a project and sought 2.5% of the project cost as extortion, according to police. The police caught the accused as he accepted a ₹2 crore cheque.

126.title: Police deployed outside Sidhu Moosewala's residence in Punjab's Moosa
126.article_body: A large force of Punjab Police has been deployed outside the residence of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala in Moosa. He was shot dead in Mansa district. State Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring and ex-Deputy CM Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa met Moosewala’s family members on Sunday evening. "We'll take immediate action against gangster and persons involved," Mansa SSP, Gaurav Toora, said.

127.title: T20s may be batters' game but bowlers win you matches: Hardik
127.article_body: After defeating RR to win IPL 2022 in their first-ever season, GT captain Hardik Pandya said, "T20s may be batters' game but bowlers win you [matches]." He added, "We spoke about creating a legacy...everyone will remember this was the team who started this journey." GT restricted RR to 130/9 and won the game by seven wickets in 18.1 overs.

128.title: Nagpur woman drinks pesticide after mistaking it for cough syrup, dies
128.article_body: A 74-year-old woman, Nagobai Vijay Koku, died after she drank pesticide after mistaking it for cough syrup in Nagpur. Police said that the woman had been ailing for the past few days. A police official said that the woman had consumed the pesticide on May 21 and died on Sunday in a nearby hospital.

129.title: Pune civic body planning to build walking plaza at Sarasbaug
129.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to build a walking plaza at Sarasbaug after clearing the encroachments along the road. "The anti-encroachment department sealed all 56 stalls and took action against the owners," said an official. "We have decided to create a walking plaza on the same road allowing these stalls to work in their stipulated areas," he added.

130.title: Who are Goldy Brar and Lawrence Bishnoi, suspects in Sidhu Moosewala's killing?
130.article_body: Punjab's DGP VK Bhawra said Lawrence Bishnoi gang and Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar are involved in Sidhu Moosewala's killing. Brar, whose real name is Satinder Singh, is part of Bishnoi's gang and is wanted in many criminal cases by Indian authorities. Bishnoi is lodged in a Rajasthan jail and his gang has criminal records in Delhi, Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana.

131.title: Like demon preaching vedas: FRL's independent directors on Amazon's 'fraud' claim
131.article_body: The independent directors of Future Retail Limited (FRL) have rejected Amazon's allegations that the company facilitated a fraudulent strategy for the transfer of 835 stores to Reliance Retail and called it a "false statement". In a letter, they wrote, "It is not for a company like yours to preach governance to us. This is akin to a demon preaching vedas."

132.title: People think I know police department, I get pleas for help: Anup on 'Crime...'
132.article_body: Actor Anup Soni, while talking about his role as a host on 'Crime Patrol', said that people have a misconception that he knows the entire police department. "I get pleas for help all the time! I get so many emails from people. Now how do I explain to them that I am a common man like you," he added.

133.title: Jos Buttler creates history, scores most runs by an overseas player in an IPL season
133.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler has created history by scoring the most runs by an overseas player in an IPL season. Buttler aggregated 863 runs in IPL 2022, overtaking David Warner's tally of 848 runs in IPL 2016. Only Virat Kohli (973 runs in IPL 2016) has scored more runs in an IPL season than Buttler.

134.title: Hardik's wife Nataša tears up on meeting him after GT win IPL 2022, video viral
134.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya's wife Nataša Stanković teared up on meeting Hardik after his team defeated RR to win IPL 2022 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Sunday. A video has gone viral showing the duo meeting after GT's win. Hardik can be seen consoling her as she gets emotional.

135.title: Buttler throws helmet, gloves in frustration after getting out in IPL final, video viral
135.article_body: A video has gone viral showing RR opener Jos Buttler throwing his helmet and gloves in frustration after getting out in the IPL 2022 final against GT. Buttler was dismissed for 39(35) on the bowling of GT captain Hardik Pandya. GT went on to defeat RR by seven wickets in the final to clinch IPL 2022.

136.title: Mahesh Babu known for witty remarks, I've seen SRK doing it: Adivi Sesh
136.article_body: Reacting to actor Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark, actor Adivi Sesh has said, "We South Indian people are aware of the fact that Mahesh is known for his witty and fun remarks." "I have seen Shah Rukh (Khan) sir doing it, but those don't become headlines," he added. Adivi stated that Mahesh's remark was said in "half jest".

137.title: Pune reports 59 new COVID-19 cases, majority in city
137.article_body: Pune district registered 59 new COVID-19 cases, the Maharashtra health department said on Sunday. No new deaths were recorded and the number of active cases stood at 333. The majority of the new cases were reported in the Pune city area where 43 infections were detected. Over 20,000 people have died of COVID-19 in the district so far.

138.title: Video shows 2 cars tailing Sidhu Moosewala's vehicle before he was shot dead
138.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing two cars tailing Sidhu Moosewala's vehicle moments before the singer-politician was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district. "Two cars intercepted [his vehicle] which followed heavy firing," the police said. As per the police, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi gang from Canada has taken the responsibility for killing Moosewala.

139.title: Crash site of Nepal plane carrying 22 people including 4 Indians located, pic surfaces
139.article_body: The crash site of Nepal's Tara Air plane carrying 22 people including four Indians has been located. The Nepal Army Spokesperson shared a picture from the crash site and wrote, "Search and rescue troops have physically located the plane crash site. Details will be followed...Crash site: Sanosware, Thasang-2, Mustang." The flight had lost contact at around 10 am on Sunday.

140.title: Gujarat Titans defeat Rajasthan Royals to win IPL 2022 in their first-ever season
140.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated Rajasthan Royals (RR) by seven wickets in the final at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad to win IPL 2022 in their first-ever season. GT restricted RR to 130/9 in their 20 overs and went on to chase the target in 18.1 overs. RR, who had won IPL in 2008, were featuring in their second final.

141.title: I'm working on my strike rate to earn place in CWG, T20Is squads: Taniyaa
141.article_body: India Women wicketkeeper-batter Taniyaa Bhatia said she has been working on her strike rate to earn a spot in India's squad ahead of 2022 Commonwealth Games and upcoming T20Is. Taniyaa didn't play a single match in 2022 World Cup despite being included in squad. "I thought during...World Cup that when I go back I'll work on my batting," she added.

142.title: Salah, Mane didn't have same freshness in Champions League final: Wenger
142.article_body: Ex-Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger said Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane lacked the "same freshness and belief" that they can make the difference in Liverpool's 0-1 loss to Real Madrid in 2022 Champions League final. "Overall they came short, we must be honest, because of Thibaut Courtois." Real Madrid goalkeeper Courtois made nine saves, most in a Champions League final.

143.title: Don't tell my mother, she's critical: Sister of woman on missing flight to police
143.article_body: The elder sister of an Indian woman who was onboard the Nepal flight that's suspected to have crashed told police not to inform their mother about the incident. Thane resident Vaibhavi Bandekar Tripathi's sister made the request as her mother is in a critical condition, an official said. Vaibhavi's estranged husband and their two children were also on the flight.

144.title: One of Moosewala's last songs titled 'The Last Ride' had pic of shot up car on cover
144.article_body: After Sidhu Moosewala's death on Sunday, some fans talked about the Punjabi singer's song 'The Last Ride' that was released two weeks ago. The song's album cover showed a BMW car that US rapper Tupac Shakur was shot dead in, in 1996. Moosewala was shot dead while driving his jeep in Punjab's Mansa.

145.title: EU unity on Russian sanctions starting to crumble, says Germany
145.article_body: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck on Sunday said that European Union's unity was "starting to crumble" ahead of a summit to discuss an oil embargo against Russia and plans to cut dependence on Russian energy. EU leaders are scheduled to meet next week to discuss these measures. The bloc has imposed economic sanctions on Russia over the invasion of Ukraine.

146.title: Climate-aid pledges by rich nations are worthless, says Seychelles
146.article_body: Seychelles' President Wavel Ramkalawan has said that climate-aid pledges by industrialised nations are worthless. He claimed that the promises made at last year's United Nations Climate Change Conference, COP26, have not been met. Ramkalawan also said he expects nothing better at this year's COP27 that is scheduled to be held in Egypt.

147.title: IPL share video of Lockie Ferguson clocking fastest delivery of IPL 2022
147.article_body: The IPL have shared a video of GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson clocking the fastest delivery of IPL 2022. Ferguson clocked 157.3 kmph on the last delivery of RR's fifth over in IPL 2022 final. RR opener Jos Buttler was beaten by the delivery which was bowled just short of a yorker length outside the off stump.

148.title: Cong releases list of 10 candidates for RS polls, fields P Chidambaram from TN
148.article_body: The Congress on Sunday released its list of 10 candidates for the Rajya Sabha elections. The party has fielded P Chidambaram from Tamil Nadu, Randeep Singh Surjewala from Rajasthan and Ajay Maken from Haryana. The elections for 57 seats spread across 15 states is scheduled to take place on June 10.

149.title: Ukraine Prez visits frontline areas outside Kyiv 1st time since war
149.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visited troops on frontlines of the country's northeastern Kharkiv region on Sunday, marking his first official appearance outside Kyiv since the war began. He reportedly carried gifts and commendations for the troops. Zelenskyy also toured destroyed residential buildings, noting that their replacements have to be constructed with bomb shelters in place.

150.title: Teenagers Gauff, Fernandez enter quarter-finals at French Open
150.article_body: American Coco Gauff, the 18th seed, entered French Open quarter-finals for the second straight year after defeating Belgium's Elise Mertens 6-4, 6-0 in fourth round on Sunday. It was the 18-year-old's second career win against Mertens. Meanwhile, 19-year old Leylah Fernandez of Canada reached her maiden Roland Garros quarter-final after a 6-3, 4-6, 6-3 win over 27th seed Amanda Anisimova.

151.title: Punjab is up in flames: BJP leader on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
151.article_body: Reacting to the demise of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab, BJP leader Amit Malviya said, "Punjab is up in flames!" "Is...Sidhu Moosewala's cold-blooded murder the change AAP promised?" he asked. "[AAP chief] Arvind Kejriwal and [MP] Raghav Chadha, who run Punjab by proxy, must be held accountable for this murder," Malviya further said.

152.title: Sri Lankan PM proposes to make Prez accountable to Parliament
152.article_body: The Sri Lankan government is working to make the President and the Cabinet accountable to the Parliament, Sri Lanka's PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Sunday. Over a dozen independent committees would be set up for parliamentary oversight and supervision of financial matters, he added. Wickremesinghe's comments come amid a severe economic crisis in the country.

153.title: Singer Edava Basheer collapses on stage during live concert, dies
153.article_body: Veteran Malayalam singer Edava Basheer passed away on Saturday after collapsing onstage during a live performance in Kerala's Alappuzha. The 78-year-old was rushed to a private hospital at Cherthala but could not be saved. The late singer was a resident of Kollam and is survived by his wives Rasheeda and Rehna and four children Ullas, Beema, Umesh and Ushus Seetta.

154.title: Centre scared of Gupkar, their Kashmir policy has failed: Mufti
154.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti has claimed that the Centre is scared of People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD), also known as the 'Gupkar alliance', adding that the Centre's policy has failed in J&K. "If [Gupkar comes] together, [Centre's]...plan will fail in...valley," she added. PAGD is a political grouping which was formed after the abrogation of Article 370.

155.title: Newborn's body found floating in Raj well day after 5 bodies recovered
155.article_body: A newborn baby's body was seen floating in a well in Rajasthan's Jaipur, a day after bodies of three sisters, two of whom were pregnant, and their two children were recovered from the same well. Police said the newborn's body has been sent to a hospital for a DNA test. Police have arrested five persons in connection with the case.

156.title: Moosewala had 2 commandos for security, didn't take them with him today: Police
156.article_body: Deceased singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala had four police commanders for his protection, of which two were withdrawn recently, Punjab Police DGP VK Bhawra said. Moosewala didn't take the two commandos with him on Sunday when he was shot dead, Bhawra added. "Moosewala had a private bulletproof car that he didn't take with him," the DGP added.

157.title: Lawrence Bishnoi gang member from Canada claims responsibility for Moosewala's murder
157.article_body: Punjab DGP VK Bhawra has said that Lawrence Bishnoi gang is involved in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder, adding, "Lucky, a member of the gang from Canada, has taken responsibility of the attack." Meanwhile, reports have claimed that gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's Canada-based associate Goldy Brar took responsibility of the attack in a Facebook post. The attack took place in Mansa district.

158.title: Over 1 lakh people sing 'Vande Mataram' during IPL 2022 closing ceremony, video viral
158.article_body: A video has gone viral showing over 1 lakh people singing 'Vande Mataram' during the IPL 2022 closing ceremony at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The crowd sang 'Vande Mataram' while AR Rahman was performing his rendition of the song. Actor Ranveer Singh also performed during the closing ceremony.

159.title: Still trying to wrap my head around it: Ajay on Sidhu Moosewala's death
159.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has reacted to 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's death. He wrote on Twitter, "Stunned by the shocking death of #SidhuMoosewala. May Waheguru give his loved ones strength in their hour of grief.  RIP departed soul. Still trying to wrap my head around this one." Sidhu was killed on Sunday in Punjab's Mansa District.

160.title: Turkey won't let terrorism-supporting nations join NATO, says Prez
160.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has said that Turkey cannot agree to the NATO membership of "terrorism-supporting" countries. He also said that talks with Finland and Sweden about their NATO bids weren't at the "expected level". Turkey has challenged the NATO membership bids from Sweden and Finland on grounds that the countries harbour people linked to a Kurdish militant group.

161.title: BJP only talks about communalism, has no other topics: Baghel
161.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Saturday claimed that the BJP only discusses issues linked to communalism and religious conversion as the party has no other topics to address. Baghel further stated that the state government has always taken action when it received reports of forced religious conversion incidents. "Every person is free to follow their religion," he added.

162.title: Artist I listened to almost everyday: Vikrant condoles Sidhu's death
162.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey has condoled the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala who was killed on Sunday in Punjab's Mansa. Vikrant tweeted, "Shocked, numb & at a loss for words. An Artist I listened to almost every single day. A voice one knew was blessed from above. Condolences & prayers for strength to his family & millions of his fans."

163.title: Our song was going to release soon: Salim on Sidhu Moosewala's death
163.article_body: Composer-singer Salim Merchant took to social media to condole the demise of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. Salim shared a picture of himself with Sidhu and wrote, "I'm shocked & saddened by the news. Sidhu was a gem.. our song was going to release very soon.. this is unbelievable." Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

164.title: Very bot-friendly rules: Musk on Twitter allowing 2,400 tweets per day to a user
164.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said Twitter has "very bot-friendly rules" after a user tweeted the platform's current technical limits for accounts. Twitter currently allows a user to send 2,400 tweets per day and make up to four changes per hour to their account's email address. Musk earlier put on hold the $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter over fake account data.

165.title: He has learnt a lot from Dhoni: Gavaskar on Hardik's captaincy in IPL 2022
165.article_body: Commenting on Hardik Pandya's captaincy style in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said, "It seems as if he has learnt a lot from MS Dhoni. He considers Dhoni his elder brother and...hero." He added, "His man-management style is Dhoni's approach...his success as captain is a positive sign for Team India." Hardik-led GT have reached the IPL final in their debut season.

166.title: Return of terrorism in Punjab: Ashoke Pandit on Sidhu Moosewala's demise
166.article_body: Indian Film & Television Directors' Association President Ashoke Pandit has posted a series of tweets reacting to Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's demise. He wrote, "[His] killing in broad day light indicates the return of terrorism in Punjab under the nose of @ArvindKejriwal who was supported by #Khalistanis. Punjab is a border state and it cannot be ruled by terror supporters."

167.title: Train services between India & B'desh resume after 2 yrs: Official
167.article_body: The passenger train services between Bangladesh and India resumed on Sunday, according to a Bangladesh Railway (BR) spokesman. Notably, the passenger train services between the two countries have resumed after a break of two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The train service between Dhaka and Kolkata would be operated five days a week, a senior BR official said.

168.title: Ex-Sri Lankan PM summoned by human rights body over May 9 clashes
168.article_body: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka has summoned ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa to obtain a statement from him regarding clashes that broke out in Colombo on May 9. This comes days after Rajapaksa gave a three-hour-long statement to authorities amid allegations that his party's supporters attacked anti-government protesters in the clashes. At least 10 people died due to violence.

169.title: Urge everyone to stay calm, guilty will be punished: Kejriwal on Moosewala's killing
169.article_body: AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said he spoke to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann about the murder of Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa, adding that the killing was "sad and shocking". He said, "The culprits will be given the harshest punishment. I request everyone to stay strong and maintain calm." Those involved in the killing won't be spared, Mann said.

170.title: Abject law & order breakdown in Punjab: Badal on Moosewala's death
170.article_body: Reacting to the murder of Congress leader and Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal said that Punjab exhibits an "abject breakdown of law and order". Expressing shock, Badal added that those responsible for the crime should be arrested immediately. Moosewala was reportedly shot over 20 times by unknown assailants in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

171.title: Sidhu Moosewala was an icon, hope perpetrators brought to justice: Sophie
171.article_body: Singer Sophie Choudry took to Twitter to mourn the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. She wrote, "This is such tragic & shocking news...A music icon, a legend! My deepest condolences to his family & his fans across the world. Hope the perpetrators are brought to justice...This is truly sad."

172.title: Lockie Ferguson bowls fastest delivery of IPL 2022 in final, breaks Umran Malik's record
172.article_body: GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022 by clocking 157.3 kmph against RR opener Jos Buttler in the final on Sunday. Ferguson broke the record held by SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, who had clocked 157 kmph against DC on May 5. Ferguson replaced Alzarri Joseph in GT's playing XI for the final.

173.title: Defending champion Djokovic enters 13th straight French Open quarters
173.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic reached his 13th consecutive French Open quarter-final following a 6-1, 6-3, 6-3 win against 15th-seeded Diego Schwartzman in the fourth round on Sunday. The top seed is now 16-0 in fourth round matches at Roland Garros. Djokovic hasn't dropped a set in the tournament so far. He awaits Rafael Nadal or Felix Auger-Aliassime in the last-eight.

174.title: He's a legend & will never be forgotten, sad day: Vishal on Sidhu's death
174.article_body: Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani reacted to Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's death, calling it a sad day. Vishal wrote on Twitter, "The news of his demise has cut deep. India has very few authentic modern artists. He was right on top of that list. I'm without words. He's a legend, his voice, his courage & his words will never be forgotten."

175.title: Nobody safe in Punjab: Ex-CM Amarinder on Sidhu Moosewala's murder
175.article_body: Former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Sunday, while condoling the demise of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, said, "Nobody is safe in Punjab." "The brutal murder of Sidhu Moosewala is shocking...Law and order has completely collapsed in Punjab," Amarinder tweeted. "The AAP government in Punjab has failed miserably," the Congress veteran further said.

176.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director calls Aamir Khan 'mahapurush' in note
