352.article_body: UP Police on Saturday used Netflix's sci-fi series 'Stranger Things' reference to warn people against clicking on "stranger links", that they are not familiar with, in order to stay safe from cybercrime activities. "Clicking on 'stranger links' may lead to #StrangerThings," UP Police tweeted. "Never open links which contain Stranger Things," UP Police added.

353.title: Stone pelting in Guj over groom riding mare, 8 police personnel injured; 70 held
353.article_body: Police arrested 70 people after a mob pelted stones at a wedding procession in Gujarat, injuring several people, including eight police personnel. The mob objected to the groom, belonging to Other Backward Class(OBC) community, riding a mare. Police said the groom had demanded police security. A police inspector said that he was assaulted with a stick by an accused.

354.title: Annoyed by bark, man shoots neighbour's dog in Jewar
354.article_body: A man allegedly shot at his neighbour's pet dog as he was annoyed by its bark in UP's Jewar. The man, identified as Monu, has been booked under IPC Section 429 (mischief by killing or maiming an animal) and 506 (criminal intimidation). The dog was taken to a vet clinic for treatment, while the accused is on the run.

355.title: India reports 2,828 new COVID-19 cases, 14 deaths in last 24 hours
355.article_body: India has reported 2,828 COVID-19 cases, 2,035 recoveries and 14 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,685 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,087, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,586.

356.title: Pak says it is open to buying oil from Russia, says 'We have an open policy'
356.article_body: Amid Western sanctions on Russia, Pakistan has said that it is open to importing oil and wheat from the country. "Our policy is clear....in terms of expanding economic and trade relations, we have an open policy, driven by national interest. Wherever we see there is a national benefit, we pursue those options and avenues," said Pakistan's Foreign Office spokesperson.

357.title: Oil India records highest-ever quarterly profit due to high fuel, gas prices
357.article_body: Government-owned Oil India Limited (OIL) recorded a net profit of ₹3,887.31 crore for the year that ended on March 2022, its highest-ever quarterly net profit. The net profit is 123.20% higher when compared with the ₹1741.59 crore profit reported last year. One of the reasons behind the record profit is high crude oil and gas prices, said OIL's top executive.

358.title: BJP, RSS only after Mughals: Asaduddin Owaisi
358.article_body: Addressing a rally in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the BJP and RSS. "If India belongs to anyone, it's Dravidians and Adivasis but BJP-RSS are only after Mughals," Owaisi said. "BJP, NCP, Congress...are the secular parties. They think that they shouldn't go to jail but it is okay if some Muslim party member goes," he added.

359.title: Rhea Chakraborty's lawyer seeks reopening of NCB probe into drug case
359.article_body: The advocate for Rhea Chakraborty, who was arrested on drug-related charges in 2020, has sought a re-opening of the investigation by the NCB (Mumbai zone). Satish Maneshinde, the lawyer who also represented Aryan Khan, who was the given clean chit in cruise drugs case, said many such "Bollywood youngsters" had been summoned by the NCB but "nobody knows for what".

360.title: Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' becomes 5th Hindi film to cross ₹100-crore mark in 2022
360.article_body: Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has become the fifth Hindi film to cross the ₹100-crore mark in 2022. The film crossed the milestone on the ninth day of its release.  Earlier, Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', Anupam Kher's 'The Kashmir Files', Ram Charan's 'RRR' (Hindi) and Yash's 'KGF 2' (Hindi) have achieved the feat.

361.title: If Yashasvi wants to play for India, he'll have to score big runs: Sehwag
361.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said RR opener Yashasvi Jaiswal needs to convert his starts into big innings if he wants to play for Team India. "Undoubtedly, his 21(13) was very useful against RCB...[but] if he has to play for India, he'll have to score big runs. He'll have to show that he is hungry for big scores," stated Sehwag.

362.title: Who wants to stay with Congress? Many ready to quit: BJP's CT Ravi
362.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Saturday said that many Congress leaders are ready to quit the party. "They (Opposition MLAs) are constantly in touch (with BJP). Who wants to stay with Congress? Many are ready to quit, not just in Goa but across the country," Ravi added. "We have seen Hardik Patel and Sunil Jakhar quitting Congress," Ravi stated.

363.title: Pic of Akshay from set surfaces online, fans call it 1st look from Soorarai Pottru remake
363.article_body: A picture of Akshay Kumar apparently from the sets of a film has been leaked online. Fans have claimed that it is Akshay's look from his upcoming Hindi remake of 'Soorarai Pottru'. "He is looking rich even in this look," a fan commented. Last month, Akshay had announced that he has started filming for the film.

364.title: Good cinema has to be seen by everyone: Sonu Sood on pan-India films
364.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, speaking about the recent success of South Indian films across the country, said, "I always believed...that good cinema has to be seen by everyone." He added that language should not be a barrier in films. "Now with South movies doing so well, and Hindi movies getting dubbed in South...conveys...that entertainment has to reach every house," Sonu said.

365.title: Always liked a challenge: Manushi on working with Akshay, YRF for 1st time
365.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, who'll make her debut with 'Samrat Prithviraj', spoke about working with Akshay Kumar and Yash Raj Films (YRF) for the first time. "They...know the kind of challenges you're facing. They...kind of make it a little comfortable for you, but I've always liked a challenge in life," she said. Manushi will be seen portraying Princess Sanyogita in the film.

366.title: Kerala govt has lenient view against terrorist activities: V Muraleedharan
366.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan on Saturday said that the Kerala government has a "lenient view" against terrorist activities and groups. His remark came after a video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans during a PFI rally in Kerala went viral. "Such things happen in Kerala repeatedly because of covert support of the government in power," Muraleedharan added.

367.title: Industrialist caught red-handed while receiving cocaine in B'luru
367.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has arrested an industrialist, Adi Srinivas Naidu, after he was caught red-handed while receiving cocaine near Sadahalli Gate on way to Kempegowda International Airport, officials said. The arrest was made earlier this week. NCB also raided Naidu's house in the city but no drugs were found. Naidu's family runs Mallya Hospital and other places in Bengaluru.

368.title: Pune civic body demolishes dilapidated 'wadas' ahead of monsoon
368.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has started a demolition drive against dilapidated 'wadas' (old structures) owing to safety concerns ahead of the monsoon season. The civic body has razed 14 'wadas' and sent notices for another 245 structures, calling them unstable and risky to stay. "Any untoward incident can happen if prompt action is not taken," said an official.

369.title: Politicians must respect each other, we're not enemies: Vice President
369.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said that in public life, politicians must respect each other. "We are not enemies but we are only political rivals," Naidu added. "This is my advice to modern politicians, you may belong to this party or that party but we all belong to this great country," Naidu stated.

370.title: Hyd Police help woman who fell due to sunstroke, offer food; share pic
370.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share a picture of a woman who reportedly fell due to a sunstroke. "WPC [Woman Police Constable] Priyanka of Karkhana [police station] took her to [police station] and offered her water [and] food. The old lady was touched by this gesture and blessed the staff. SHO Karkhana appreciated Priyanka for her kindness," police wrote.

371.title: Extremely rare event: Ather Energy issues statement after fire at EV dealership
371.article_body: Electric vehicle manufacturer Ather Energy issued a statement after a fire broke out at their Chennai dealership and led to a loss of some property and EV scooters. It said that it was an "extremely rare" incident which was caused after a high-pressure wash on a vehicle that had undergone an accident led to water entering its battery pack.

372.title: It's been a frustrating tournament personally, but I like big games: Wade
372.article_body: Ahead of the IPL 2022 final against RR, GT's Matthew Wade, who has scored 149 runs in nine games, said the tournament has been frustrating for him but he likes to perform in the "big games". He added, "I've really enjoyed...being able to turn a couple of performances on in finals, and hopefully I can do that [against RR]."

373.title: Woman killed, husband injured after speeding car hits them in Pune
373.article_body: A 60-year-old woman was killed and her 63-year-old husband injured after a speeding car reportedly hit them in Pune on Friday. The couple were said to be walking when the car struck them from behind. The victims' 32-year-old son lodged a complaint with the police, after which the car driver was arrested for rash and negligent driving.

374.title: Driver held after 16-yr-old girl dies as school bus hits bike in B'luru
374.article_body: The driver of a school bus was arrested for ramming the bus into a bike and running over a 16-year-old girl in Bengaluru. Reports said that while the deceased girl's sister and friend landed on roadside with minor injuries after being flung into air, the deceased landed on the road and was run over by the bus.

375.title: Man, mother held for murder of brother-in-law in Gurugram
375.article_body: A man and his mother were held in connection with the murder of the former's brother-in-law in Gurugram's DLF Phase 3 area. The man, identified as Suraj Rai, is accused of killing the victim, Shubhankar Bhadra, while the woman, Malti Rai, is accused of misleading the police. The incident happened due to an argument over stock market losses, police said.

376.title: Car catches fire on Pune-Mumbai Expressway; 7 women escape unhurt
376.article_body: A car's seven female passengers were able to escape unhurt after the vehicle caught on fire at Bhor Ghat on Pune-Mumbai Expressway, police officials said on Saturday. The occupants got out and moved to a safe distance from the car after driver noticed smoke coming out of the bonnet, according to police. An elderly woman was also brought out safely.

377.title: Pilot observes cracks in SpiceJet flight's windshield mid-air, flies it back to Mumbai
377.article_body: A SpiceJet plane, which was scheduled to land in Gorakhpur in Uttar Pradesh, went back to Mumbai on Saturday after its pilot observed cracks on the windshield, according to an official statement. The air traffic controller was apprised and the aircraft landed safely at the Mumbai airport, a spokesperson said.

378.title: I begged Dilip Kumar to work with me in 'Thevar...' remake: Haasan
378.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan recalled an incident when he asked late actor Dilip Kumar to work with him in the Hindi remake of 'Thevar Magan'. "I really held Dilip saab's hand and begged him, but he had decided not to act," he stated. Haasan added, "It didn't happen so I gave it to another friend...he made it with Anil Kapoor...Amrish Puri."

379.title: Deepika was furious, asked 'You'll hug me like this?': Ranveer on 'Bajirao...'
379.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he first hugged wife and actress Deepika Padukone in front of the camera while they were promoting their film 'Bajirao Mastani'. "She was furious, she asked me 'you'll hug me like this in front of the camera?'" Ranveer recalled. He added that even though it has been 10 years with Deepika, she continues to surprise him.

380.title: What have been the highest and lowest totals scored in finals in IPL history?
380.article_body: SRH hold the record for scoring the highest total in an IPL final. SRH put up 208 runs in 2016 final and went on to win against RCB by 8 runs. CSK scored 205/5 in 2011 final and beat RCB by 58 runs. CSK's 125/9 in their 23-run defeat against MI in IPL 2013 is the lowest IPL final total.

381.title: India's success with vaccination drive offers lessons for world: Bill Gates
381.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates appreciated India's COVID-19 vaccination drive after meeting Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya at the World Economic Forum. Gates tweeted, "It was great to meet...Mansukh Mandaviya and exchange perspectives on global health. India's success with the vaccination drive and the use of technology to drive health outcomes at scale offers many lessons for the world."

382.title: What are the highest individual scores in the history of IPL finals?
382.article_body: Shane Watson holds the record for the highest individual score in an IPL final. The then CSK all-rounder scored 117*(57) against SRH in IPL 2018 final. He's followed by Wriddhiman Saha, who scored 115*(55) for PBKS against KKR in IPL 2014 final. Murali Vijay's 95(52) for CSK against RCB in IPL 2011 final is third-highest score in an IPL final.

383.title: 1,500-year-old city with palaces, pyramids found in Mexico; pics released
383.article_body: The remains of a 1,500-year-old city have been found by archaeologists in the Yucatan region of Mexico. The Mayan city of Xiol (meaning 'the spirit of man') is believed to have been the home of some 4,000 people between 600 and 900 CE. An array of palaces, pyramids and plazas have also been found at the site.

384.title: Real Madrid defeat Liverpool to win Champions League for a record-extending 14th time
384.article_body: Real Madrid defeated Liverpool 1-0 at the Stade de France in Saint-Denis in a repeat of the 2018 Champions League final to win the Champions League/European Cup for a record-extending 14th time. It is Real Madrid's fourth Champions League victory in seven seasons. Six-time champions Liverpool have now finished runners-up in the competition for the fourth time.

385.title: Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas defeat Velocity to win Women's T20 Challenge for 3rd time
385.article_body: Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas defeated Deepti Sharma-led Velocity by four runs in the final to win the Women's T20 Challenge for the third time. Deandra Dottin's 62(44) and Harmanpreet's 43(29) helped Supernovas put up a total of 165/7. Velocity were restricted to 161/8 in their 20 overs, with Alana King and Sophie Ecclestone taking three and two wickets, respectively.

386.title: India's only official entry at Cannes wins top documentary award
386.article_body: Indian documentary 'All That Breathes', which was India's only official entry at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, has won the top documentary award L'Oeil d'Or. It is based on two brothers who take the initiative to save birds amid the rise of pollution. The film earlier won the World Cinema Grand Jury Prize: Documentary at the 2022 Sundance Film Festival.

387.title: If you're leading a team in IPL, you can lead India: Manjrekar on Hardik
387.article_body: Speaking about GT skipper Hardik Pandya, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar stated, "If you are leading a team in the IPL, you can lead Team India." He added, "Hardik showed us how comfortable he looked in a leadership role captaining GT." Hardik led his side to IPL final in their debut season. GT will play against RR in the final on Sunday.

388.title: Had some tough moments with injuries in my career: Nadal on 301 Slam wins
388.article_body: After achieving 301 Grand Slam wins, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said he's "very happy" about how things have been during his tennis career despite having some tough moments with injuries. "But at...same time because of tennis, I enjoyed many experiences," he added. Nadal achieved this feat after defeating Botic van de Zandschulp in 2022 French Open third round.

389.title: Ireland reports first confirmed monkeypox case
389.article_body: Ireland has confirmed its first case of monkeypox, the Health Service Executive (HSE) said in a statement on Saturday. A separate suspected case is also being investigated and test results are awaited, the country's health agency added. This was not unexpected following the presence of monkeypox cases in the UK and many European countries, it further said.

390.title: World's biggest coal miner Coal India to import for first time since 2015: Report
390.article_body: World's biggest coal miner Coal India will import coal for the first time since 2015 amid shortages, Reuters reported. "Coal India would import coal for blending on government-to-government...basis and supply...to thermal power plants of state generators and independent power producers," a letter by the Power Ministry said. This comes as India faces its worst power cuts in over six years.

391.title: Govt employees skipping poll duty in MP's Rewa will be retired: DM
391.article_body: The District Magistrate in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa has directed that government employees who are unavailable for panchayat election duty will be retired prematurely. An official circular was issued after some government officials and employees posted in Rewa expressed their inability to be available for election duty. The three-tier panchayat elections will be held from June 25 to July 8.

392.title: The trend of 'Bollywood khatam' will never happen: Rohit on B'wood vs South cinema debate
392.article_body: Rohit Shetty, commenting on the debate between South and Hindi cinema, said Bollywood will stay unaffected, while adding that southern films have been remade since the 60s. "The trend of 'Bollywood khatam' will never happen. In the 80s, when VCRs came, people said theatre will go out of business...With...boom of OTT, many people said that Bollywood is finished," he added.

393.title: US shooter sent rape threats to women, talked about shooting up schools online
393.article_body: Salvador Ramos, the 18-year-old who killed 21 people at an elementary school in US' Texas before being gunned down, had threatened women and girls with rape on a social media app, reports said. In the weeks leading up to the Texas shooting, Ramos had reportedly also threatened to shoot up schools and showed off weapons during livestreams on the app.

394.title: Aamir eats pani puri ahead of 'Laal...' trailer preview, pics viral
394.article_body: Pictures and videos of actor Aamir Khan eating pani puri ahead of the preview of the 'Laal Singh Chaddha' trailer have gone viral on social media. A video shows Aamir interacting with fans and appreciating the vendor for the pani puri. The trailer of the film will be launched during the first innings and second time-out of the IPL finale.

395.title: Over half of Afghanistan's population is dependent on aid: UN
395.article_body: More than half of Afghanistan's population is dependent on humanitarian assistance, according to the United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR). "One in two people in Afghanistan do not know where their next meal is coming from," it said. However, the Taliban government has denied the claims made by UNHCR and said that poverty has been declining in Afghanistan.

396.title: Bopanna-Middelkoop beat 2nd seeds Mektic-Pavic to reach French Open quarters
396.article_body: India's Rohan Bopanna and his Dutch partner Matwe Middelkoop saved five match points to knock out second seeds Mate Pavic and Nikola Mektic in the men's doubles third round at the French Open on Saturday. The 16th seeds defeated the reigning Wimbledon champions 6-7(5-7), 7-6(7-3), 7-6(12-10) in two hours 32 minutes to enter the quarter-finals.

397.title: 7 trekkers go missing in U'khand, SDRF sends chopper for rescue
397.article_body: Seven trekkers have gone missing on Pandav Shera route in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag at a height of around 4,500 metres. The State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) on Saturday sent a high-altitude rescue team and a chopper to the area to launch a search and rescue operation. "Their last message...was that they were...injured and without any food or water," an official said.

398.title: Ukraine's ex-Prez Petro Poroshenko blocked from leaving the country
398.article_body: Ukraine's former President Petro Poroshenko was prevented from leaving the country to take part in a meeting of a NATO body in Lithuania. Poroshenko could not leave due to "technical problems" with a permit, according to the Ukrainian media. Notably, Poroshenko is being investigated for treason in a probe he has described as a politically motivated attack.

399.title: AAP govt has eliminated illegal sand mining from Punjab: Minister
399.article_body: Punjab Mining Minister HS Bains has said the AAP government has eliminated illegal sand mining from the state. He said that legal mining has increased, adding, "Last year, 35,000-40,000 MT of extraction used to happen daily...now it has crossed one lakh MT." Earlier, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had said that a new comprehensive pro-people sand mining policy will be framed.

400.title: Video of Bihar girl with 4 arms and legs surfaces, Sonu Sood says 'Treatment started'
400.article_body: Recently, a video of a 2.5-year-old girl from Bihar with 4 arms and legs surfaced online. According to reports, the girl has 4 arms and legs since birth and her parents do not have money for treatment. Reacting to the video, actor Sonu Sood shared a picture and tweeted, "Treatment has been started. Just pray."

401.title: Krishna, McCoy kept RCB under pressure: Tendulkar on RR's Qualifier 2 win
401.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar has said RR's key bowlers Prasidh Krishna and Obed McCoy kept RCB under pressure to help their side win Qualifier 2 by seven wickets in Ahmedabad to enter the final on Friday. "[RCB's] 157 wasn't a good total at all on this surface," he added. Krishna registered bowling figures of 4-0-22-3 while McCoy posted 4-0-23-3 in the match.

402.title: Woman poisons her 3 children, later attempts suicide in Kolkata
402.article_body: A woman poisoned her three children and later attempted suicide in Kolkata. While her two daughters lost their lives, the woman and her son are currently said to be in a critical condition. Local residents claimed she used to complain that her husband had stopped sending her money, due to which she was unable to bear expenses for basic needs.
